Author: BRadmin
Content: email to phonenumber@txt.att.net / messaging.sprintpcs.com / etc... once you receive the text, a reply will (should? works for most major carriers - att on my iphone tested) send the message back to the original email address.

Author: ig1
Content:
It reminded me very much of the line from fight club:
"You're not your job. You're not how much money you have in the bank. You're not the car you drive. You're not the contents of your wallet. You're not your fucking khakis. You're the all-singing, all-dancing crap of the world. "

Author: rms
Content: No...    but I'm not sure why. Go English.

Author: gaius
Content:
Agreed. Here in the UK, for any journey over a couple of hundred miles it is cheaper to fly. I used to regularly travel from London to Nottingham by train, which cost 2-3x as much as it would have to fly to Amsterdam or Paris.

On the other hand, I'll happily pay the extra cash for Eurostar as it just saves so much hassle either end. But I'm fortunate enough to be able to do that; if I was on a shoestring then easyJet all the way.

Author: gaius
Content: I would be fine with this... Provided they agreed to go on paying my salary for the 2 years in which I was unable to work.
